alert.note: Alert for Orange; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 2:15PM EST until January 14 at 2:45PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... South central Orange County in central Vermont... Eastern Windsor County in southern Vermont... * Until 245 PM EST. * At 213 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Sharon to near North Chester, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar and webcams. IMPACT...Dangerous and life-threatening travel conditions are expected to develop rapidly in the warning area. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 1 and 15. Interstate 91 between mile markers 39 and 49, between mile markers 51 and 61, between mile markers 63 and 71, near mile marker 73, and between mile markers 75 and 87. Locations impacted include... Woodstock, Chester, Hartland Four Corners, Cavendish, Thetford Hill State Park, Perkinsville Village, Pomfret, Thetford, Hartland, Windsor, Woodstock Village, Sharon, Thetford Center, Quechee, Norwich, Baltimore, Springfield, Weathersfield, West Windsor, and Hartford. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...OBSERVED SNOW SQUALL IMPACT...SIGNIFICANT
